div.a: Grab and Go MENU for MAY

span.div: The Tuscarawas Valley Local School District is offering inter-district open enrollment with school
systems throughout Ohio. Applications will not be accepted after August 21, 2020 unless the
student is currently enrolled in the district.
New students residing out of the district who wish to enter Tuscarawas Valley Local Schools for
the 2020-2021 school year must complete the open enrollment application process through the
district’s website at www.tvtrojans.org by navigating to the Parents & Community dropdown
and selecting the OneView Parent Portal link where new open enrollment application can be
made. Applications will be accepted on a first-come, first-served basis, and parents must have a
contingency plan in place in the event that Tuscarawas Valley’s enrollment is too high for the
Current Tusky Valley students who do not reside in the district should apply through their
existing OneView Parent Portal account. Students must reapply for open enrollment every
For questions or assistance with the open enrollment process, please call Central Office at

div.a: Trojans for the Win! (by Mrs. Dixie Chumney)

div.span: It's OKAY to not be okay

span.img: On behalf of the Alcohol Drug Addiction and Mental Health Services Board and related providers, Tusky Valley shares this important reminder: Your emotions and mental health matter, and it is okay to not be okay. There is always hope, and there are people to help.

div.a: Check out these resources available to residents of Tuscarawas and Carroll Counties!
Special Meeting of the Tuscarawas Valley Local Schools Board of Education.

br.span: On Wednesday, April 22nd at 10:00 AM the Tuscarawas Valley Local Schools Board of Education will hold a Special Meeting via Zoom. Those who wish to view this meetimg may do so on our YouTube channel.

span.div: Please click this link to complete a Google Form for help with general questions, technology, guidance, food service, or medical concerns. We will review your question and get back to you as soon as we can.

div.span: CHANGE! Grab and Go Meals MONDAYS ONLY

span.div: Starting MONDAY, MARCH 23, 2020: Meals will be delivered to these "grab and go" locations for the entire week. Meal bags include 5 lunches and 5 breakfasts for the week. Meals are free to all children ages 1-18.

div.span: TV Plan to Transition to Remote Learning LETTER (3.17.20 through 4.3.20)
Transition to Remote Learning VIDEO Message from Mr. Murphy

span.div: Congratulations to TVHS senior Taylor Galigher as she signed her letter of intent to continue her academic and golf careers at Clarion University, Taylor plans to major in speech pathology.

div.span: Hooks Signs With The College of Wooster

span.div: Congratulations to TVHS senior Amber Hooks as she will continue her academic and softball career at The College of Wooster. Amber plans on majoring in education.

div.div: Good luck to TVHS senior Noah Love as he will compete for a state title at the OHSAA State Wrestling Championships this weekend. Noah's first match will be Friday afternoon at approximately 3:30 PM. Fellow seniors Corey Keim and Justen Ladrach are state alternates.

span.p: This is a census year, and it is really important that EVERYONE be counted. By mid-March, households will receive official Census Bureau mail with three options for responding: online, by phone, or by mail. Let's make sure that every member of our TV family, all ages, are counted!
